biography.content: Dr Lawlor is a medical graduate of University College Dublin. He completed a Palliative Medicine Fellowship at the University of Alberta in 1996 and subsequently worked in the Edmonton Palliative Care Program. In 2004 he took up a post as consultant in palliative medicine at Our Lady’s Hospice and St James’s Hospital. In January 2010 he moved to Ottawa to take up a post as Medical Director of the Palliative Care Unit at Elisabeth Bruyère and Associate Professor in the Faculty of Medicine at University of Ottawa. His research interests include cognitive dysfunction, pain assessment and classification, and opioid side-effects. He was appointed as Gillin Bruyère Clinician Scientist with the Elisabeth Bruyère Research Institute in February 2011 with prime funding to pursue research on cognitive dysfunction in palliative care. In January 2012 he began a three year term as Visiting Professor in the Faculty of Medicine, University of Lisbon.

keyword.content: delirium; palliative care; hospice; pain; cognitive
